title: Babe Lyon
text: George Cardinal "Babe" Lyon (March 30, 1907 – December 22, 1970) was a professional <a href="American%20football">football</a> player in the <a href="National%20Football%20League">National Football League</a> (NFL) and the <a href="American%20Football%20League%20%281936%29">second American Football League</a> (AFL). Over the span of his career, Babe played for the <a href="New%20York%20Giants">New York Giants</a>, <a href="Portsmouth%20Spartans">Portsmouth Spartans</a>, <a href="Cleveland%20Indians%20%28NFL%201931%29">Cleveland Indians</a>, <a href="Chicago%20Bears">Chicago Bears</a>, <a href="Brooklyn%20Dodgers%20%28NFL%29">Brooklyn Dodgers</a> and <a href="St.%20Louis%20Gunners">St. Louis Gunners</a> of the NFL. He played again in 1936 for the <a href="Rochester%20Tigers">Rochester Tigers</a> of the AFL.
